job_tasks.phrase: You develop and execute test plans, identify and report bugs, and collaborate with our development team to resolve issues.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes traditional software engineering tasks related to testing, bug identification, and collaboration with developers for issue resolution, fitting the definition of Software Development & Integration.

job_tasks.phrase: You will work closely with our development team to create and implement comprehensive test plans, perform manual and automated tests, and report on the findings.
job_tasks.justification: This sentence details the creation and execution of test plans and reports, which are core software engineering activities focused on ensuring product quality and integration.

job_tasks.phrase: Develop, implement, and maintain test plans and test cases
job_tasks.justification: This bullet point directly refers to the creation, implementation, and upkeep of testing strategies and specific test cases, which falls under Software Development & Integration.

job_tasks.phrase: Execute manual and automated tests to identify software defects
job_tasks.justification: Executing tests, whether manual or automated, to find defects is a fundamental part of the software development lifecycle and quality assurance, aligning with Software Development & Integration.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with the development team to resolve identified issues
job_tasks.justification: This task involves working with developers to fix bugs, which is a collaborative software development activity aimed at improving the product.

job_tasks.phrase: Perform regression testing to ensure product stability
job_tasks.justification: Regression testing is a standard software engineering practice to ensure that new changes haven't negatively impacted existing functionality, contributing to product stability.

job_tasks.phrase: Document and report test results, and provide feedback for continuous improvement
job_tasks.justification: Documenting and reporting test outcomes, along with providing feedback for improvement, are essential parts of the software development and quality assurance process.

job_tasks.phrase: Participate in code reviews and provide input on quality assurance standards and processes
job_tasks.justification: Engaging in code reviews and contributing to QA standards are direct activities within the software development and integration lifecycle, focusing on code quality and process improvement.

job_tasks.phrase: Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies in software testing
job_tasks.justification: While this touches on learning, the context is specifically about staying current with software testing technologies, which supports the core software engineering tasks of the role.

soft_skills.justification: This phrase directly mentions a key soft skill related to identifying and resolving issues encountered during testing.
This phrase highlights the need for teamwork and interaction with the development team, which falls under communication and collaboration.

soft_skills.phrase: Collaborate with the development team to resolve identified issues
soft_skills.justification: This reiterates the importance of collaboration with the development team for issue resolution, fitting the communication and collaboration category.
Providing feedback is a form of communication aimed at improving processes and outcomes, aligning with the communication and collaboration category.

soft_skills.phrase: provide input on quality assurance standards and processes
soft_skills.justification: Contributing input on standards and processes involves communication and collaboration with the team to define best practices.

soft_skills.phrase: Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies in software testing
soft_skills.justification: This phrase indicates a need for continuous learning and adaptation to new developments within the software testing domain.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses exclusively on Quality Assurance (QA) tasks, such as developing and executing test plans, identifying bugs, performing regression testing, and collaborating with developers. There is no mention of AI/ML model development, fine-tuning, prompt engineering, RAG, or any AI-specific technologies. All identified tasks fall under Macro-Category A (Core Software Engineering), specifically 1.A.1. Software Development & Integration. Therefore, the most appropriate profile is 'Software Engineer'.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and specific about its responsibilities, which are entirely focused on traditional software testing and quality assurance. There is no ambiguity or mention of AI/ML, making the classification straightforward and the profile assignment highly confident.
